rows.label: tev032501_JNK0010
rows.name: Inquire

rows.label: tev032501_SEL0011
rows.name: Ask Jeshero about the Ma-non ship.

rows.label: tev032501_JNK0020
rows.name: Discuss

rows.label: tev032501_SEL0021
rows.name: Ask Jeshero about recent developments.[ST:wait ]

rows.label: tev032501_SEL0031
rows.name: Ask Jeshero about the Ma-non.

rows.label: tev032501_SEL0041
rows.name: Ask Jeshero about the Ma-non.

rows.label: tev032501_MSG0001
rows.name:
Your human metalwork isn't so good when compared
to Ma-non metalwork, is it? Very very weak...[ST:wait ]

rows.label: tev032501_MSG0002
rows.name:
The Ma-non ship is strong, don't you think?
That's because we used strong materials in its
construction.[ST:wait ]

rows.label: tev032501_MSG0003
rows.name:
This ship came crashing through Mira's atmosphere
with nary a scratch, didn't it? Even the Ganglion's anti-
air fire couldn't touch it.[ST:wait ]

rows.label: tev032501_MSG0004
rows.name:
Humans must build things equally strong, or you will
never survive a war with the Ganglion, will you?[ST:wait ]

rows.label: tev032501_MSG0008
rows.name: Do you know a human named Omari?[ST:wait ]

rows.label: tev032501_MSG0009
rows.name:
This Omari fellow was very very surprised when I
carved a tiny sliver out of a Nopon matchmaking stone,
you know?[ST:wait ]

rows.label: tev032501_MSG0010
rows.name:
After you left, he came up and asked me to teach him
how to do such things, right?[ST:wait ]

rows.label: tev032501_MSG0011
rows.name:
He seemed nice enough, so I agreed to teach him.
Even threw in a few extra lessons for good measure,
which seemed pretty nice of me?[ST:wait ]

rows.label: tev032501_MSG0012
rows.name: Omari thanked me with pizza. Which is great, right?[ST:wait ]

rows.label: tev032501_MSG0017
rows.name:
Ma-non have one character flaw, don't they?
Once we're fascinated by something, we aren't satisfied
until we we we completely pick it apart.[ST:wait ]

rows.label: tev032501_MSG0018
rows.name:
...Hmmm? You think this is an admirable trait?
Depends on your definition of "pick apart," doesn't it?[ST:wait ]

rows.label: tev032501_MSG0019
rows.name:
The Ma-non will do anything to further their research,
you know? Even if it means breaking laws...[ST:wait ]

rows.label: tev032501_MSG0020
rows.name:
I would never do such a thing, of course. But Lulladu?
The Ma-non running a repair shop in the industrial
district? I'd keep an eye on him if I were you![ST:wait ]

rows.label: tev032501_MSG0026
rows.name:
Ma-non have one character flaw, don't they?
Once we're fascinated by something, we aren't satisfied
until we we we completely pick it apart.[ST:wait ]

rows.label: tev032501_MSG0027
rows.name:
And sometimes this turns out badly. Like with Lulladu?
The Ma-non running a repair shop in the industrial
district? I hear he stole a Zaruboggan's staff.[ST:wait ]

rows.label: tev032501_MSG0028
rows.name: Deplorable, right?[ST:wait ]

rows.label: tev032501_MSG0029
rows.name:
I mean, if it were me, I would have made a perfect
replica of the staff so no one knew I stole it,
you know?[ST:wait ]

rows.label: tev032501_MSG0030
rows.name: ...Hey, don't glare like that. It's a good plan, right?[ST:wait ]
